channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Trump inflames tensions and justifies violence -- and there's a reason why
Reporter asks Trump to condemn Kenosha shooter. Watch his response
item.description: When asked about the ongoing protests in Portland, Oregon, and Kenosha, Wisconsin, President Donald Trump refused to condemn 17-year-old Kyle Rittenhouse, who is facing homicide charges for allegedly killing two protesters in Kenosha.

item.title: Detention of CGTN anchor shows that in Xi Jinping's China, not even the propagandists are safe
item.description: In Cheng Lei's last WeChat post before she disappeared, the Chinese state TV host posed in a bright green dress on a Shake Shack-branded rickshaw outside the newly opened Beijing branch of the American restaurant chain.

item.title: Past vaccine disasters show why rushing a one now would be 'colossally stupid'
Schools in France are reopening, but infection rates are rising
Two sherrifs decline to send deputies to help police Portland protests
'I'm disappointed,' Kenosha mayor on Trump's upcoming visit
item.description: Kenosha Mayor John Antaramian tells CNN's Pamela Brown that it is "too soon" for President Trump or Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden to be visiting the city.

item.title: Biden condemns violence and asks Americans: 'Do you really feel safe under Donald Trump?'
Wedding announcement goes viral after groom's ex reveals he cheated on her when he met bride
item.description: When Nikyta Moreno saw her ex-husband in the New York Times' Wedding section, it came with a startling realization: He had been cheating on her. Now, after publishing her side of the story, the internet has her back.

item.title: Ex-police chief: Police should never welcome the help of vigilantes
item.description: A bystander video recorded shortly before the fatal shooting of two people in Kenosha, Wisconsin, shows the accused shooter, Kyle Rittenhouse, with an assault-style rifle, milling among a group of other armed civilians claiming to be standing guard against people gathered to protest the police shooting, two days earlier, of Jacob S. Blake.

item.title: Jacob Blake's father says he's been receiving threats after his son's shooting
item.description: Jacob Blake Sr. says his 29-year-old son's shooting and the protests that followed have led to threats against his family.

item.title: North Korea faces dangerous triple threat
item.description: In a rare move, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has raised alarm over three crisis facing the country; sanctions, the coronavirus pandemic and a looming typhoon. The urgent calls come amid unusual political movements. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

item.title: The hospitals where Covid-19 sufferers wait for others to die before they can be put on a respirator
item.description: Catastrophic conditions in chaotic ill-equipped hospitals overflowing with Covid-19 patients -- patients forced to wait for others to die so they can be put on ventilators that could save their lives.

item.title: Former NASA astronaut Leland Melvin was never afraid to go to space. But a police stop made him sweat
item.description: A police stop could have cost former NASA astronaut Leland Melvin his career in space before he ever got started.

item.title: Facebook threatens to block users in Australia from sharing news
item.description: Facebook is warning its users in Australia that it will stop allowing them to share local and international news if the country moves forward with new legislation that would force the company to pay media outlets for the use of their news content.

item.title: Massive 14-foot crocodile captured at tourist spot in Australia
item.description: An enormous saltwater crocodile measuring 14.4 feet (4.3 meters) has been caught at a remote tourist hotspot in Australia's Northern Territory.

item.title: Internet loves this 12-year-old skateboarder's comeback moment
item.description: A 12-year-old skateboarder makes a flying comeback after a scary fall. Jeanne Moos reports on a "Sky" with no limits.

item.title: Alabama football players' march for equality ends at the spot where Blacks were told they weren't welcome years ago
item.description: It was a powerful moment, rife with symbolism.

item.title: Ed Sheeran and Cherry Seaborn announce the birth of their first child
item.description: Ed Sheeran has announced the birth of his first child with his wife Cherry Seaborn.

item.title: How fashion can play its part in the climate crisis
These 'living' clothes can absorb carbon emissions
Michael B. Jordan pens powerful tribute to Chadwick Boseman
item.description: One of the last times Chadwick Boseman and Michael B. Jordan spoke, Boseman said they were forever linked, Jordan wrote on Instagram Monday.

item.title: Naomi Osaka wears mask honoring Breonna Taylor before winning US Open match
item.description: Naomi Osaka may have won her first-round match at the US Open -- but she wanted to ensure people didn't forget about Breonna Taylor.

item.title: New video shows moments before deadly shooting in Portland
item.description: Disturbing new video shows the moments before a fatal shooting happened in Portland, Oregon, during protest clashes that left one person dead. Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden released a statement condemning the deadly violence and encouraged President Donald Trump to follow suit.

item.title: India accuses China of 'provocative military movements' on border
item.description: India on Monday accused Chinese troops of taking "provocative" actions near a disputed border high in the Himalayas, violating previous deals between the two nuclear-armed rivals intended to ease tensions in the region.

item.title: Why are India and China sparring at the border?
item.description: Two nuclear powers. One invisible line that separates them, high in the Himalayas. Decades of disputes over it. Here's what you need to know about the contested border between India and China.

item.title: The 10 US Senate seats most likely to flip in 2020
NATO: Russia's attempt to intercept US bomber 'significant' violation of law
item.description: A Russian military jet violated NATO airspace on Friday while it was attempting to intercept a US Air Force B-52 bomber flying near the Danish island of Bornholm, the alliance said in a statement Monday, calling the incident a "significant violation of international law."

item.title: Porn star Ron Jeremy faces 20 more sexual assault charges
item.description: Porn star Ron Jeremy is facing an additional 20 counts of forcible rape, sexual battery, sodomy and more, according to the Los Angeles District Attorney's Office.

item.title: Two strangers, with the same first name, and a terrifying story about ketamine in policing
item.description: Elijah McKnight admits he was drunk. The 25-year-old says he'd had a fifth of Jim Beam with a buddy before passing out on his way home on a sidewalk just outside Aurora, Colorado. That is where sheriff's deputies found him.

item.title: Frenchwoman arrested for 'obscene' video on holy bridge
item.description: A 27-year-old Frenchwoman has been arrested for making a nude video of herself on a holy bridge over India's Ganges River.

item.title: 'Hotel Rwanda' film hero Paul Rusesabagina arrested
item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, who saved hundreds of Rwandans during the genocide by sheltering them in the hotel he managed, and saw his story made into the Hollywood film 'Hotel Rwanda', has been arrested on terror related offenses, Rwandan authorities announced.

item.title: CNN fact-checker: As journalists we must stand up for truth
item.description: Brian Stelter speaks to CNN fact-checker Daniel Dale, who went viral after fact-checking the Republican National Convention.

item.title: Denzel Washington, who once paid Chadwick Boseman's tuition, pays tribute
item.description: Chadwick Boseman was referred to as "the next Denzel Washington" and the first one has remembered Boseman as a "gentle soul."

item.title: What quarantining around the world really looks like
item.description: It's hard to remember a time when quarantine wasn't a regular part of our vocabulary, yet, for most of us, it was only six months ago that we'd rarely heard the word used or spoken it aloud -- outside of describing a scene from an historical novel or a Hulu show.

item.title: New 'Rising Phoenix' Netflix documentary will make you laugh and cry
item.description: The Phoenix. It lives, dies and rises from the ashes to live again.

item.title: Here's why Adele was wearing Bantu knots, a Jamaican flag bikini top and other carnival wear
item.description: Adele caused quite the stir on social media Sunday after posting a picture of herself on Instagram wearing Bantu knots, a Jamaican flag bikini top and other carnival wear popular in Afro-Caribbean cultures.

item.title: Bronze Age Britons kept human remains on display in their homes
item.description: People living in Bronze Age Britain kept human remains as relics and even crafted them into musical instruments, a new study has suggested.

item.title: Champagne makers are throwing out grapes. Here's why
item.description: The 2020 champagne harvest is underway with a promising output but champagne producers have agreed to throw out much of the harvest to keep the prices high to compensate for the drop in demand due to the Covid-19 pandemic. CNN's Melissa Bell explains.

item.title: Jürgen Schadeberg, the legendary photographer who chronicled Mandela and the apartheid experience
item.description: A young Miriam Makeba dancing with her eyes closed. Her future husband Hugh Masekela receiving a trumpet from "Satchmo", the jazz legend better known as Louis Armstrong.

item.title: Gauff exits US Open as organizers use 'enhanced protocol plan' after positive Covid test
item.description: Coco Gauff lost her opening match at a different looking US Open against former semifinalist Anastasija Sevastova, while two fellow pros who came into contact with a player who tested positive for the coronavirus were allowed to compete on the opening day.

item.title: This endangered penguin loves to watch shows about penguins
item.description: Pierre the penguin loves to watch shows and documentaries about other penguins, as he recuperates from a daring journey from islands in the Indian or South Atlantic Ocean, in Australia's Perth Zoo.

item.title: World's tallest prefab skyscrapers will rise in Singapore -- but they're being built in Malaysia
item.description: Modules of 56-story skyscrapers to be built in Malaysia, stacked in Singapore

item.title: Blackpink and Selena Gomez's 'Ice Cream' serves up scoops of saccharine style
item.description: After teasing fans with posters, snippets and stills for weeks, South Korean megaband Blackpink and American pop princess Selena Gomez unveiled their track "Ice Cream" on Friday. And in addition to the song's dangerously catchy, upbeat vibe, the accompanying video is a stylistic treat, too.

item.title: Trump's day of fury reflects how he has now firmly settled on a campaign of demagoguery to save his presidency
Why Trump is really going to Kenosha
item.description: Donald Trump, who took office at a time of falling crime and rising prosperity, laid out a vision of "American carnage" in his twisted inaugural address. Four years later, under his watch, that carnage has come to pass. His federal officers have wielded weapons against overwhelmingly peaceful protesters. The President calls the protesters thugs, anarchists and terrorists.

item.title: Biden's GOP endorsements show the cracks in Trump's coalition
item.description: Joe Biden is attracting more crossover endorsements from prominent members of the opposing party than any other presidential candidate from either side in decades. That doesn't guarantee the former vice president victory in November, but history suggests it could signal a lasting break in the Republican coalition that provides new opportunities to Democrats for years to come.

item.title: Trump says he won't meet with Jacob Blake's family
item.description: President Donald Trump is not going to meet with Jacob Blake's family in Wisconsin because they wanted to involve lawyers, he said at a news conference on Monday.

item.title: The 10 US Senate seats most likely to flip in 2020
item.description: • Analysis: This is the widest presidential battleground in a very long time • Opinion: Trump's depraved plan to try and win reelection

item.title: Fact check: Trump makes more false claims about Biden and protests
item.description: President Donald Trump billed his Monday appearance in the White House briefing room as a "news conference."
